New Records: The White Sox matched an AL record set by the 1988 Baltimore Orioles by losing 21 games in a row from July 10 to Aug. 5.
Key Match Events: The Angels rallied to tie the game three times, and Jordyn Adams hit a single in the 13th inning to drive in Eric Wagaman with the winning run.
Pre-Game Insights: White Sox interim manager Grady Sizemore emphasized the importance of competing every night, regardless of the team's record.
Post-Match Reflections: Sizemore stated that everyone in the locker room is aware of the team's record and that it's not a winning season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox own MLB worsts with 123 home runs, 470 runs, 449 RBIs, a team.222 batting average, and 596 walks allowed.
Others: The team has used more than 60 players this season, a team record, and has struggled with talent fleeing over the past two seasons.
